newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Tanzania refugee population totals about 400,000.
newsitem.headline: Tanzania refugee population totals about 400,000.

text.p: Around 400,000 refugees languish in Tanzania camps after fleeing Burundi and the Democratic Republic of Congo, a senior U.N. refugee agency official said on Wednesday.
About 300,000 have come to camps in western Kigoma region and northwest Ngara from Burundi and 100,000 from the former Zaire, said Lennart Kotsalainen, deputy UNHCR representative in Tanzania.
Around 17,000 refugees arrived from Burundi in May and 10,000 were expected in June, while the flow from the Democratic Republic of Congo all but dried up, he said.
"It is of course a concern that there are people coming all the time, but there's been no dramatic increase (from Burundi)," he said.
Ethnic violence in Burundi pits guerrillas of the majority Hutu tribe who comprise about 85 percent of the tiny country against the government's Tutsi-dominated army.
Tens of thousands of Zaireans fled to Tanzania at the start of a rebellion by troops who seized the capital in May and changed the country's name. Thousands now want to return home, UNHCR said.
